channel.title: Needing some guidence :D
channel.description:
okay, i'll get straight to the point, i've been planning on getting a new guitar for quite sometime, as my first one, a basic peavy raptor exp, has a broken bridge and i'm like 8 hours from the nearest shop and dont want to spend $200 fixing a $20 guitar. Although the problem is, i listen to metal, so the next guitar i have basically just bores me makes me feel as if i'm going no where, it's a fender acoustic d20 200, very smexy guitar, nice sound, just not my type. So i was planning on trying something like http://www.axemusic.com/product.asp?numRecordPosition=41&P_ID=16126&PT_ID=27 or if i could pull up the money, possibly this, as i've seen many bands use this guitar, either that or it was a gibson model of it : http://www.guitarcenter.com/Epiphone-Les-Paul-Custom-Electric-Guitar-100176337-i1149998.gc
now, as i said, i live about 8 hours away from a nearest shop, so i can't really test the sound and see if i should get some new pickups, but based of reviews, both of these can cover my likings, although i believe i need some more insight.
I've probably played a average of, 4 months? i played about a month and stop periodically, for the reason, i hate the sound, and theres no one near me to teach. so i found someone who plays the guitar, hoped he could help, and he did, police officer lawlz, anyway, he was just teaching me chords, don't get my wrong, it's obviously progress, how ever, he was guiding toward more country based genre's, and i was learning the complete opposite i beleive of what i had planned on. I realize it takes time and practice as well.
So basically, my question is, which of those two guitars would best fit something like a band, say uhm... all that remains, possibly Iwrestledabearonce, from "Tastes like kevin bacon", i prefer something that can get a low, deep sound, as well as a clear, high tone. another band i guess could be divine heresy, face breaker(song), orrrrr Parkway Drive?
If you believe one of these guitars CAN fit it, but you think there's some suggest upgrades, say some better pickups, please state it, as it will help.
If you noticed the prices, i'm REALLY on a budget, so don't post anything about ehh $650?
Extra - i think i need a new amp tbh, if i end up going with the cheaper, dean, i probably can fork up about $200 for an amp, i realize it's not much, but i think anything would be better than what i got atm, Dean Markley k-20x 40 watt, although tbh, it sounds so dull and has no distortion, and then my small peavy backstage 15 watt.
Thanks for the time people :D.

item.title: Needing some guidence :D
item.dc:creator: @Baros_Rocks Baros Rocks
item.description:
@Baros_Rocks wrote:

the bank:

What? it’s the Alexi signature…

His guitars are based off Jackson’s Randy Rhoads, and in my opinion the RR3 is better than the Alexi 200.

Read full topic

item.title: Needing some guidence :D
item.dc:creator: @the_bank the bank
item.description:
@the_bank wrote:

[quote=“Baros Rocks, post:11, topic:314522”][quote author=the bank link=topic=410998.msg3033066#msg3033066 date=1258515766]

espalex600.jpg1000×2507

Win?

$469 for the 200, $1300 for the 600.[/quote]
I’d prefer a Jackson RR3 rather than the 200, but from what I’ve seen, the 600 is a pretty nice guitar.[/quote]What? it’s the Alexi signature…

Read full topic

item.description:
@davidude36 wrote:

Whatever you do, don’t get:

It won’t help you learn guitar and will make you look like even more of a faggot when you are playing wipe-out on it.

item.title: Needing some guidence :D
item.dc:creator: @Unhandled Unhandled
item.description:
@Unhandled wrote:

I think the Epiphone is the way to go, it’s a far more versatile guitar (you won’t look like a tard if you ever play something other than metal).

Read full topic
